meanings.definition: The study of the ways in which the sound system of a language changes over time.
meanings.sent1: In morphophonemics, linguists analyze how language sounds evolve.
meanings.sent2: Researchers in morphophonemics observe how the pronunciation of words alters through history.
meanings.sent3: The class on morphophonemics made the students realize how language can transform over the years.
meanings.sent4: Studying morphophonemics is like watching the language's melody change with time.
meanings.sent5: The book on morphophonemics painted a vivid picture of the evolution of speech sounds.

meanings.definition: The branch of linguistics that deals with the interaction between morphological and phonological processes.
meanings.sent1: Morphophonemics explores how word structure and sound patterns influence each other.
meanings.sent2: Linguists use morphophonemics to understand how word forms affect pronunciation.
meanings.sent3: The playful dance between morphology and phonology is at the heart of morphophonemics.
meanings.sent4: In the world of language, morphophonemics is like the intricate weaving of word shapes and sounds.
meanings.sent5: The study of morphophonemics brings to light the intricate relationship between word structure and sound changes.
